title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praises the New England Patriots' culture, urging free agents to join this offseason.
Patriots boast strong cap space, respected leadership, and recent successful signings like Stefon Diggs and Mack Hollins.
Coach Mike Vrabel and QB Drake Maye credited for team's rapid rebuild, appealing to upcoming free agents.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks eighth among the best free-agent signings in New England Patriots history.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal with $63 million guaranteed in the 2025 offseason.
He has recorded 5.5 sacks this season, contributing significantly to the Patriots' Super Bowl LX run.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major moves ahead of NBA trade deadline, focusing on potential smaller additions.
Possible trade candidates include Nets center Nic Claxton and Mavericks center Daniel Gafford to bolster Celtics' big man needs.
Guards and centers such as Keon Ellis, Ivica Zubac, and Isaiah Jackson among Celtics' potential targets for roster improvement.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Something in the Way Fest 2026 features two dozen indie and alt-rock bands at Boston's Roadrunner venue January 31-February 1.
Headlining bands include Angel Du$t, Tigers Jaw, and GUV, with varied styles from hardcore to indie emo and power pop.
Brooklyn band Momma donates merchandise proceeds to the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota, advocating for immigrant rights.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced under a tent at Raymond James Stadium before an outdoor NHL game due to Florida's climate.
The tent, 34 feet high and covering 30,000 square feet, helps maintain ice integrity with refrigeration and humidity control.
Despite efforts to protect the ice, it remained soft, reminding players of conditions during previous outdoor games.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands gathered in Boston Common for the 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest, demanding an end to cooperation with ICE.
The protest was part of a national campaign across 300 cities, inspired by recent deaths linked to ICE agents.
Participants called for stronger protections for immigrants and accountability from local and state officials.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand protesters gathered in Boston Common to oppose President Trump's immigration policies amid freezing weather.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was organized by Mass 50501 and local groups, part of a national series.
Protesters marched to the State House, with speeches and music from Somerville's Good Trouble Brass Band featured.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests Red Sox may pursue another trade to strengthen their infield before 2026 season.
Potential targets include Isaac Paredes from Astros and Christian Walker, although Walker's fit is less likely.
Red Sox considering Marcelo Mayer for third base, with Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton splitting second base duties.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots advance to Super Bowl LX after a surprising 14-3 season turnaround under coach Mike Vrabel.
Quarterback Drake Maye led the league in completion percentage, yards per attempt, and passer rating.
Drake Maye's father is surprised by Patriots' Super Bowl appearance, citing tough win in AFC title game.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth and Mike Tirico will call Super Bowl LX for NBC featuring the Patriots and Seahawks.
Collinsworth has broadcasted five Super Bowls involving the Patriots, sharing the booth with Al Michaels in previous games.
The NBC team, including Collinsworth, covered significant Patriots games this season, showcasing their evolution under coach Mike Vrabel.
